trans-unit.source: Create Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps with intuitive and distinctive user interaction experiences that are optimized for touch but functionally consistent across input devices.
trans-unit.target: Create Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps with intuitive and distinctive user interaction experiences that are optimized for touch but functionally consistent across input devices.

trans-unit.source: Touch design guidelines
trans-unit.target: Touch design guidelines

trans-unit.source: Touch design guidelines
trans-unit.target: Touch design guidelines

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: Create Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps with intuitive and distinctive user interaction experiences that are optimized for touch but functionally consistent across input devices.
trans-unit.target: Create Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps with intuitive and distinctive user interaction experiences that are optimized for touch but functionally consistent across input devices.

trans-unit.source: Dos and don'ts
trans-unit.target: Dos and don'ts

trans-unit.source: Design applications with touch interaction as the primary expected input method.
trans-unit.target: Design applications with touch interaction as the primary expected input method.

trans-unit.source: Provide visual feedback for interactions of all types (touch, pen, stylus, mouse, etc.)
trans-unit.target: Provide visual feedback for interactions of all types (touch, pen, stylus, mouse, etc.)

trans-unit.source: Optimize targeting by adjusting touch target size, contact geometry, scrubbing and rocking.
trans-unit.target: Optimize targeting by adjusting touch target size, contact geometry, scrubbing and rocking.

trans-unit.source: Optimize accuracy through the use of snap points and directional "rails".
trans-unit.target: Optimize accuracy through the use of snap points and directional "rails".

trans-unit.source: Provide tooltips and handles to help improve touch accuracy for tightly packed UI items.
trans-unit.target: Provide tooltips and handles to help improve touch accuracy for tightly packed UI items.

trans-unit.source: Don't use timed interactions whenever possible (example of appropriate use: touch and hold).
trans-unit.target: Don't use timed interactions whenever possible (example of appropriate use: touch and hold).

trans-unit.source: Don't use the number of fingers used to distinguish the manipulation whenever possible.
trans-unit.target: Don't use the number of fingers used to distinguish the manipulation whenever possible.

trans-unit.source: Additional usage guidance
trans-unit.target: Additional usage guidance

trans-unit.source: First and foremost, design your app with the expectation that touch will be the primary input method of your users.
trans-unit.target: First and foremost, design your app with the expectation that touch will be the primary input method of your users.

trans-unit.source: If you use the platform controls, support for touchpad, mouse, and pen/stylus requires no additional programming, because Windows 8 provides this for free.
trans-unit.target: If you use the platform controls, support for touchpad, mouse, and pen/stylus requires no additional programming, because Windows 8 provides this for free.

trans-unit.source: However, keep in mind that a UI optimized for touch is not always superior to a traditional UI.
trans-unit.target: However, keep in mind that a UI optimized for touch is not always superior to a traditional UI.

trans-unit.source: Both provide advantages and disadvantages that are unique to a technology and application.
trans-unit.target: Both provide advantages and disadvantages that are unique to a technology and application.

trans-unit.source: In the move to a touch-first UI, it is important to understand the core differences between touch (including touchpad), pen/stylus, mouse, and keyboard input.
trans-unit.target: In the move to a touch-first UI, it is important to understand the core differences between touch (including touchpad), pen/stylus, mouse, and keyboard input.

trans-unit.source: Do not take familiar input device properties and behaviors for granted, as touch in Windows 8 does more than simply emulate that functionality.
trans-unit.target: Do not take familiar input device properties and behaviors for granted, as touch in Windows 8 does more than simply emulate that functionality.

trans-unit.source: You will find throughout these guidelines that touch input requires a different approach to UI design.
trans-unit.target: You will find throughout these guidelines that touch input requires a different approach to UI design.

trans-unit.source: Compare touch interaction requirements
trans-unit.target: Compare touch interaction requirements

trans-unit.source: The following table shows some of the differences between input devices that you should consider when you design touch-optimized Windows Store apps.
trans-unit.target: The following table shows some of the differences between input devices that you should consider when you design touch-optimized Windows Store apps.

trans-unit.source: Factor Touch interactions Mouse, keyboard, pen/stylus interactions Touchpad Precision The contact area of a fingertip is greater than a single x-y coordinate, which increases the chances of unintended command activations.
trans-unit.target: Factor Touch interactions Mouse, keyboard, pen/stylus interactions Touchpad Precision The contact area of a fingertip is greater than a single x-y coordinate, which increases the chances of unintended command activations.

trans-unit.source: The mouse and pen/stylus supply a precise x-y coordinate.
trans-unit.target: The mouse and pen/stylus supply a precise x-y coordinate.

trans-unit.source: Same as mouse.
trans-unit.target: Same as mouse.

trans-unit.source: The shape of the contact area changes throughout the movement.
trans-unit.target: The shape of the contact area changes throughout the movement.

trans-unit.source: Mouse movements and pen/stylus strokes supply precise x-y coordinates.
trans-unit.target: Mouse movements and pen/stylus strokes supply precise x-y coordinates.

trans-unit.source: Keyboard focus is explicit.
trans-unit.target: Keyboard focus is explicit.

trans-unit.source: Same as mouse.
trans-unit.target: Same as mouse.

trans-unit.source: There is no mouse cursor to assist with targeting.
trans-unit.target: There is no mouse cursor to assist with targeting.

trans-unit.source: The mouse cursor, pen/stylus cursor, and keyboard focus all assist with targeting.
trans-unit.target: The mouse cursor, pen/stylus cursor, and keyboard focus all assist with targeting.

trans-unit.source: Same as mouse.
trans-unit.target: Same as mouse.

trans-unit.source: Human anatomy Fingertip movements are imprecise, because a straight-line motion with one or more fingers is difficult.
trans-unit.target: Human anatomy Fingertip movements are imprecise, because a straight-line motion with one or more fingers is difficult.

trans-unit.source: This is due to the curvature of hand joints and the number of joints involved in the motion.
trans-unit.target: This is due to the curvature of hand joints and the number of joints involved in the motion.

trans-unit.source: It's easier to perform a straight-line motion with the mouse or pen/stylus because the hand that controls them travels a shorter physical distance than the cursor on the screen.
trans-unit.target: It's easier to perform a straight-line motion with the mouse or pen/stylus because the hand that controls them travels a shorter physical distance than the cursor on the screen.

trans-unit.source: Same as mouse.
trans-unit.target: Same as mouse.

trans-unit.source: Some areas on the touch surface of a display device can be difficult to reach due to finger posture and the user's grip on the device.
trans-unit.target: Some areas on the touch surface of a display device can be difficult to reach due to finger posture and the user's grip on the device.

trans-unit.source: The mouse and pen/stylus can reach any part of the screen while any control should be accessible by the keyboard through tab order.
trans-unit.target: The mouse and pen/stylus can reach any part of the screen while any control should be accessible by the keyboard through tab order.

trans-unit.source: Finger posture and grip can be an issue.
trans-unit.target: Finger posture and grip can be an issue.

trans-unit.source: Objects might be obscured by one or more fingertips or the user's hand.
trans-unit.target: Objects might be obscured by one or more fingertips or the user's hand.

trans-unit.source: This is known as occlusion.
trans-unit.target: This is known as occlusion.

trans-unit.source: Indirect input devices do not cause occlusion.
trans-unit.target: Indirect input devices do not cause occlusion.

trans-unit.source: Same as mouse.
trans-unit.target: Same as mouse.

trans-unit.source: Object state Touch uses a two-state model: the touch surface of a display device is either touched (on) or not (off).
trans-unit.target: Object state Touch uses a two-state model: the touch surface of a display device is either touched (on) or not (off).

trans-unit.source: There is no hover state that can trigger additional visual feedback.
trans-unit.target: There is no hover state that can trigger additional visual feedback.

trans-unit.source: A mouse, pen/stylus, and keyboard all expose a three-state model: up (off), down (on), and hover (focus).
trans-unit.target: A mouse, pen/stylus, and keyboard all expose a three-state model: up (off), down (on), and hover (focus).

trans-unit.source: Hover lets users explore and learn through tooltips associated with UI elements.
trans-unit.target: Hover lets users explore and learn through tooltips associated with UI elements.

trans-unit.source: Hover and focus effects can relay which objects are interactive and also help with targeting.
trans-unit.target: Hover and focus effects can relay which objects are interactive and also help with targeting.

trans-unit.source: Same as mouse.
trans-unit.target: Same as mouse.

trans-unit.source: Rich interaction Supports multi-touch: multiple input points (fingertips) on a touch surface.
trans-unit.target: Rich interaction Supports multi-touch: multiple input points (fingertips) on a touch surface.

trans-unit.source: Supports a single input point.
trans-unit.target: Supports a single input point.

trans-unit.source: Same as touch.
trans-unit.target: Same as touch.

trans-unit.source: Supports direct manipulation of objects through gestures such as tapping, dragging, sliding, pinching, and rotating.
trans-unit.target: Supports direct manipulation of objects through gestures such as tapping, dragging, sliding, pinching, and rotating.

trans-unit.source: No support for direct manipulation as mouse, pen/stylus, and keyboard are indirect input devices.
trans-unit.target: No support for direct manipulation as mouse, pen/stylus, and keyboard are indirect input devices.

trans-unit.source: Same as mouse.
trans-unit.target: Same as mouse.

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: Indirect input has had the benefit of more than 25 years of refinement.
trans-unit.target: Indirect input has had the benefit of more than 25 years of refinement.

trans-unit.source: Features such as hover-triggered tooltips have been designed to solve UI exploration specifically for touchpad, mouse, pen/stylus, and keyboard input.
trans-unit.target: Features such as hover-triggered tooltips have been designed to solve UI exploration specifically for touchpad, mouse, pen/stylus, and keyboard input.

trans-unit.source: UI features like this have been re-designed for the rich experience provided by touch input, without compromising the user experience for these other devices.
trans-unit.target: UI features like this have been re-designed for the rich experience provided by touch input, without compromising the user experience for these other devices.

trans-unit.source: Use touch feedback
trans-unit.target: Use touch feedback

trans-unit.source: Appropriate visual feedback during interactions with your app helps users recognize, learn, and adapt to how their interactions are interpreted by both the app and Windows 8.
trans-unit.target: Appropriate visual feedback during interactions with your app helps users recognize, learn, and adapt to how their interactions are interpreted by both the app and Windows 8.

trans-unit.source: Visual feedback can indicate successful interactions, relay system status, improve the sense of control, reduce errors, help users understand the system and input device, and encourage interaction.
trans-unit.target: Visual feedback can indicate successful interactions, relay system status, improve the sense of control, reduce errors, help users understand the system and input device, and encourage interaction.

trans-unit.source: Visual feedback is critical when the user relies on touch input for activities that require accuracy and precision based on location.
trans-unit.target: Visual feedback is critical when the user relies on touch input for activities that require accuracy and precision based on location.

trans-unit.source: Display feedback whenever and wherever touch input is detected, to help the user understand any custom targeting rules that are defined by your app and its controls.
trans-unit.target: Display feedback whenever and wherever touch input is detected, to help the user understand any custom targeting rules that are defined by your app and its controls.

trans-unit.source: Create an immersive interaction experience
trans-unit.target: Create an immersive interaction experience

trans-unit.source: The following techniques enhance the immersive experience of Windows Store apps.
trans-unit.target: The following techniques enhance the immersive experience of Windows Store apps.

trans-unit.source: Targeting
trans-unit.target: Targeting

trans-unit.source: Targeting is optimized through:
trans-unit.target: Targeting is optimized through:

trans-unit.source: Touch target sizes
trans-unit.target: Touch target sizes

trans-unit.source: Clear size guidelines ensure that applications provide a comfortable UI that contains objects and controls that are easy and safe to target.
trans-unit.target: Clear size guidelines ensure that applications provide a comfortable UI that contains objects and controls that are easy and safe to target.

trans-unit.source: Contact geometry
trans-unit.target: Contact geometry

trans-unit.source: The entire contact area of the finger determines the most likely target object.
trans-unit.target: The entire contact area of the finger determines the most likely target object.

trans-unit.source: Scrubbing
trans-unit.target: Scrubbing

trans-unit.source: Items within a group are easily re-targeted by dragging the finger between them (for example, radio buttons).
trans-unit.target: Items within a group are easily re-targeted by dragging the finger between them (for example, radio buttons).

trans-unit.source: The current item is activated when the touch is released.
trans-unit.target: The current item is activated when the touch is released.

trans-unit.source: Rocking
trans-unit.target: Rocking

trans-unit.source: Densely packed items (for example, hyperlinks) are easily re-targeted by pressing the finger down and, without sliding, rocking it back and forth over the items.
trans-unit.target: Densely packed items (for example, hyperlinks) are easily re-targeted by pressing the finger down and, without sliding, rocking it back and forth over the items.

trans-unit.source: Due to occlusion, the current item is identified through a tooltip or the status bar and is activated when the touch is released.
trans-unit.target: Due to occlusion, the current item is identified through a tooltip or the status bar and is activated when the touch is released.

trans-unit.source: Accuracy
trans-unit.target: Accuracy

trans-unit.source: Design for sloppy interactions by using:
trans-unit.target: Design for sloppy interactions by using:

trans-unit.source: Snap-points that can make it easier to stop at desired locations when users interact with content.
trans-unit.target: Snap-points that can make it easier to stop at desired locations when users interact with content.

trans-unit.source: Directional "rails" that can assist with vertical or horizontal panning, even when the hand moves in a slight arc.
trans-unit.target: Directional "rails" that can assist with vertical or horizontal panning, even when the hand moves in a slight arc.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Guidelines for panning](guidelines-for-panning.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Guidelines for panning](guidelines-for-panning.md).

trans-unit.source: Occlusion
trans-unit.target: Occlusion

trans-unit.source: Finger and hand occlusion is avoided through:
trans-unit.target: Finger and hand occlusion is avoided through:

trans-unit.source: Size and positioning of UI
trans-unit.target: Size and positioning of UI

trans-unit.source: Make UI elements big enough so that they cannot be completely covered by a fingertip contact area.
trans-unit.target: Make UI elements big enough so that they cannot be completely covered by a fingertip contact area.

trans-unit.source: Position menus and pop-ups above the contact area whenever possible.
trans-unit.target: Position menus and pop-ups above the contact area whenever possible.

trans-unit.source: Tooltips
trans-unit.target: Tooltips

trans-unit.source: Show tooltips when a user maintains finger contact on an object.
trans-unit.target: Show tooltips when a user maintains finger contact on an object.

trans-unit.source: This is useful for describing object functionality.
trans-unit.target: This is useful for describing object functionality.

trans-unit.source: The user can drag the fingertip off the object to avoid invoking the tooltip.
trans-unit.target: The user can drag the fingertip off the object to avoid invoking the tooltip.

trans-unit.source: For small objects, offset tooltips so they are not covered by the fingertip contact area.
trans-unit.target: For small objects, offset tooltips so they are not covered by the fingertip contact area.

trans-unit.source: This is helpful for targeting.
trans-unit.target: This is helpful for targeting.

trans-unit.source: Handles for precision
trans-unit.target: Handles for precision

trans-unit.source: Where precision is required (for example, text selection), provide selection handles that are offset to improve accuracy.
trans-unit.target: Where precision is required (for example, text selection), provide selection handles that are offset to improve accuracy.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Guidelines for selecting text and images (Windows Runtime apps)](guidelines-for-textselection.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Guidelines for selecting text and images (Windows Runtime apps)](guidelines-for-textselection.md).

trans-unit.source: Timing
trans-unit.target: Timing

trans-unit.source: Avoid timed mode changes in favor of direct manipulation.
trans-unit.target: Avoid timed mode changes in favor of direct manipulation.

trans-unit.source: Direct manipulation simulates the direct, real-time physical handling of an object.
trans-unit.target: Direct manipulation simulates the direct, real-time physical handling of an object.

trans-unit.source: The object responds as the fingers are moved.
trans-unit.target: The object responds as the fingers are moved.

trans-unit.source: A timed interaction, on the other hand, occurs after a touch interaction.
trans-unit.target: A timed interaction, on the other hand, occurs after a touch interaction.

trans-unit.source: Timed interactions typically depend on invisible thresholds like time, distance, or speed to determine what command to perform.
trans-unit.target: Timed interactions typically depend on invisible thresholds like time, distance, or speed to determine what command to perform.

trans-unit.source: Timed interactions have no visual feedback until the system performs the action.
trans-unit.target: Timed interactions have no visual feedback until the system performs the action.

trans-unit.source: Direct manipulation provides a number of benefits over timed interactions:
trans-unit.target: Direct manipulation provides a number of benefits over timed interactions:

trans-unit.source: Instant visual feedback during interactions make users feel more engaged, confident, and in control.
trans-unit.target: Instant visual feedback during interactions make users feel more engaged, confident, and in control.

trans-unit.source: Direct manipulations make it safer to explore a system because they are reversible—users can easily step back through their actions in a logical and intuitive manner.
trans-unit.target: Direct manipulations make it safer to explore a system because they are reversible—users can easily step back through their actions in a logical and intuitive manner.

trans-unit.source: Interactions that directly affect objects and mimic real world interactions are more intuitive, discoverable, and memorable.
trans-unit.target: Interactions that directly affect objects and mimic real world interactions are more intuitive, discoverable, and memorable.

trans-unit.source: They don't rely on obscure or abstract interactions.
trans-unit.target: They don't rely on obscure or abstract interactions.

trans-unit.source: Timed interactions can be difficult to perform, as users must reach arbitrary and invisible thresholds.
trans-unit.target: Timed interactions can be difficult to perform, as users must reach arbitrary and invisible thresholds.

trans-unit.source: In addition, the following are strongly recommended:
trans-unit.target: In addition, the following are strongly recommended:

trans-unit.source: Manipulations should not be distinguished by the number of fingers used.
trans-unit.target: Manipulations should not be distinguished by the number of fingers used.

trans-unit.source: Interactions should support compound manipulations.
trans-unit.target: Interactions should support compound manipulations.

trans-unit.source: For example, pinch to zoom while dragging the fingers to pan.
trans-unit.target: For example, pinch to zoom while dragging the fingers to pan.

trans-unit.source: Interactions should not be distinguished by time.
trans-unit.target: Interactions should not be distinguished by time.

trans-unit.source: The same interaction should have the same outcome regardless of the time taken to perform it.
trans-unit.target: The same interaction should have the same outcome regardless of the time taken to perform it.

trans-unit.source: Time-based activations introduce mandatory delays for users and detract from both the immersive nature of direct manipulation and the perception of system responsiveness.
trans-unit.target: Time-based activations introduce mandatory delays for users and detract from both the immersive nature of direct manipulation and the perception of system responsiveness.

trans-unit.source: **Note** An exception to this is where you use specific timed interactions to assist in learning and exploration (for example, press and hold).
trans-unit.target: **Note** An exception to this is where you use specific timed interactions to assist in learning and exploration (for example, press and hold).

trans-unit.source: Appropriate descriptions and visual cues have a great effect on the use of advanced interactions.
trans-unit.target: Appropriate descriptions and visual cues have a great effect on the use of advanced interactions.

trans-unit.target: Related articles
